website_summaries.verdict: Most helpful for fonts that are 14 points and smaller, which translates to books for third grade and older.
pros: Set of 7 strips in high-contrast colors measuring 7.25 x 1.25 inches
Works for font sizes 14 and smaller
Relatively small window helps with sentence tracking
Multiple colors let students see which makes the biggest difference
cons: Plastic is not transparent enough for some

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to help with convergence insufficiency.
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly for a child that struggles with convergence insufficiency. These have helped him stay focused to read each line instead of skipping around.
customer_reviews.author: Got2BMoody

customer_reviews.title: Love these reading strips
customer_reviews.text: Best price I could find for these reading strips. I love the many choices in colors, you get all seven. They help keep your eyes tracking the one line and the color helps focus better. Must buy for anyone with dyslexia or any reading problems. I was first introduced to these strips by my daughters teacher, she had them available for children who couldn't focus on the words in the book. These items should not be so expensive and this company provides great prices for people on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: julie wood

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These are a MUST HAVE purchase for beginning readers or ones that struggle keeping their place. I have also used them for some of my dyslexic students and it did help (depending upon the color). My students were thrilled when we got these in the mail and were even happier when they saw their fluency growing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gray area completely blocks text!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed; I've used other brands easy reading strips with my students and appreciate how the gray areas tones the text down, but they can still faintly see through it to help them track where they've been. This is a completely opaque bookmark with one colored clear area. Unlike the strips with a slightly translucent gray area, I can reproduce something like this easily with a hole in card stock and some highlighter tape.
customer_reviews.author: Janie James

customer_reviews.title: Boosted confidence in young readers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for 2 of my students whom i thought would benefit from them. They liked being able to choose their own color. They are excited when they get to use them for reading. I have noticed a slight difference in their reading fluency. Instead of getting lost and taking an extra extended period of time to read a few sentences, they both read more fluently. The grey areas block out the other sentences so they do not get lost in their reading. It has boosted their confidence in their reading ability.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Improves reading for the reluctant readers
customer_reviews.text: Great product. These really help my students read their text books and chapter books. Size of a bookmark so its easy for them to leave in their book for the next reading or put in their pencil box for safe keeping. The students try out each color until they find the one that works the best. So helpful for those kiddos that have difficulty reading, staying focused, fatigue easily, and have disabilities. Definately keeping these in stock in my resource classroom. Just bought three more packs to share with more struggling readers. These are so helpful to anyone I have had try them. I'm very thankful to have these on hand to support my students.
customer_reviews.author: Tazzie

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if that's because they don't help them or if they don't like them. Either way
customer_reviews.text: I would spend more money and get the full sheets. This is challenge find because font size changes and so it makes these harder to use. I bought them to help my kids and they don't use them. I don't know if that's because they don't help them or if they don't like them. Either way, they didn't work for us. That being said...the quality seems well made. They transperancy is truly transparent and the book mark works well as a book mark. It's worth the price to "check it out". It just depends of if they work for you or not. Seller and product is great.
customer_reviews.author: postie

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: These came highly recommended from my son’s therapist\OT after being diagnosed with ADHD that affected his reading comprehension. They came quickly and were well packaged. They’re durable and hold up to his 9yo inattentiveness. I love that they come in different colors so he can experiment with which colors help hone his focus the most. Love this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Foreman F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my sister who teaches special ed. She said these were some of the best reading strips she has ever used & couldn't believe how inexpense they were in comparison to the supply books she orders from.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy M. Redder

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Having a child with dyslexia my doctor advised to get multiple colors of reading strips and find out which color she is able to read with more smoothly.... I have to say... i was happy to have found this package. she has chosen yellow and orange as her favorite strips... The other's I gave to my son who is an Elementary school teacher.... If you have a child with dyslexia... or are a teacher who has problem readers in your class that have yet to be diagnosed. This is definitely the perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: bellanapoli

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is not as clear as I would like it to be, it has little specks of darker plastic in it and it's super clear plastic in general, the clear one is not so bad but some of the other ones I found make reading worse sometimes. I would recommend going for a more expensive brand of these as I ended up giving up on these and using them as bookmarks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some kids love these
customer_reviews.text: Some kids love to use these. For them, it keeps letters from moving or disappearing altogether. You need to try all the colors as some like the blue and some the red and some see no difference at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Useful for reading
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I am an I intervention Specialist and have students who often lose their place when they read or the glare from the lights make it difficult to see the words on paper or in a text.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Once we figured out the color that works best,it has helped tremendously with eye tracking difficulties and comprehension. It has definitely helped reduce the stress and struggle of backtracking and re-reading the same sentence more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used these Carpet Markers in my second grade classroom for approx. one week...one week was long enough! They didn't attach to my carpet and would not stay in place. They defeated the whole purpose of purchasing this item which was so the students had their spot to sit when in circle time. The custodian also had an issue when he sucked a couple of them in the vacuum. Maybe it was the type of carpet I have, it is a short weave but on the plush side, but these did not work for me at all. Giving them away now to someone else who they may work for.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for struggling readers!~
customer_reviews.text: These strips are perfect for any student who needs something to help eyes remain focused on the line he/she is reading. Tracking words is made easier, and it helps children who are overwhelmed by "busy" pages. I bought these for my son, who is dyslexic, and he loves them. I will also use them in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for people with dyslexia
customer_reviews.text: I’m dyslexic and in college and these are a God send. Some of the colors work better for me but I appreciate the verity so I could test them all. Also very helpful that it’s solid above and below the strip as it helps me focus. I have a different one that is clear and transparent blue that does not work as well for me.
customer_reviews.author: s.marie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Reading Tool!
customer_reviews.text: They work! I didn’t know I had dysgraphia, but when I learned I bought the strips and they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for focus and eye tracking
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these at home for reading and at school! He has an easier time focusing on the words and the paragraph. It’s great for tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Used these with my dyslectic 8 year old and they are fantastic, really genius!
customer_reviews.author: T. Morris

customer_reviews.title: These work wonders.
customer_reviews.text: My sister in-law suggested that I try these to see if they helped my youngest daughter with her mild dyslexia since my brother finds them so helpful for his. After researching more into the use and theory behind these I decided to give them a try. I am so happy that I did. My daughter said the green one helps her the most. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: BHP

customer_reviews.title: Guided Reading Strips Asst. Set of 7
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter finds these strips to be useful to keep the words from moving on a page. They still have not determined which color works the best for her. I like that they can also serve as a bookmark.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Cheney

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: The product was just as it was advertised. My son and husband found the colors that work best for them.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Leaf

customer_reviews.title: Helps with reading
customer_reviews.text: I tutor a gentleman who has dyslexia. These helps him stay focused on the words he is reading.
customer_reviews.author: vmgr_252

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping students on task
customer_reviews.text: I tried these with a student that has a problem staying focused. It seemed to keep him on task longer and also able to return to where he left off quicker. He was able to be more productive while requiring less prompting.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase these again for the value and amount
customer_reviews.text: Item as described, arrived in timely fashion, all is good!
customer_reviews.author: CourtneyFreng

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful for us
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping they would help my daughter with her reading struggles, which appear to be some form of dyslexia, but she said non of them helped and several of them made it harder for her. Perhaps they work for others, but they did not help us.
customer_reviews.author: drawgs

customer_reviews.title: Great product for struggling readers
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic way to assist a young reader who struggles with tracking words across the page. The variety of colors give the user many choices to improve their reading success.
customer_reviews.author: CTWT

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: A must buy! I have a child who have reading difficulties and this helps him with fluency and accuracy!
customer_reviews.author: mzsassy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE!!!! I was hesitant if my 6th graders would go for these, because they are very self-conscious when it comes to reading. However they really enjoy the different colors. Need to order another set! We call them easy readers!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandson who is dyslexic. They weren't expensive so I thought it would be a good set for him to see which color works best for him. He did definitely have a 'best' color and it does help him so they were very well worth my time and money to get them. Now we know which color is best for him if he ever wants to go to a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: JanKay

customer_reviews.title: Great accommodation/modification for students!
customer_reviews.text: These trackers keep students focused and on task. They are able to keep up with the text even if they struggle with reading, comprehension, and vocabulary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for classroom
customer_reviews.text: I am an ELA learning support teacher and bought these for our class read alouds. Some of the children have a hard time keeping their place when following along. These helped most of them tremendously. Even the students who didn't need them loved using them because iof the fun colors!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Schaeffer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Love these strips! I use them with my dyslexic son as well as my students in my small group as well. They always decide aheaad of time what/if any color works best then pick their strip the next time we do small group. It’s really helping a lot of my students.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Buda

customer_reviews.title: My boys love these, helps my 5 year old stay in ...
customer_reviews.text: My boys love these, helps my 5 year old stay in the correct place instead of his eyes trying to jump ahead when reading. Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.author: RDunham

customer_reviews.title: Good for students who easily lose their place
customer_reviews.text: Really like these to use with my students who lose their place when reading easily. The only thing is wish is that they were cheaper or cane with more.
customer_reviews.author: MLC6293

customer_reviews.title: Guided reader to aid in reading chapter books for young learners!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter gets overwhelmed trying to read. She was so excited about these guides. They helped her focus and not feel overwhelmed by all the words on the page. You get one of each color in the order. This are thin but well made flexible material and can double as a bookmark!
customer_reviews.author: Tabs S.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The colors are fun and my kids love these! However rated 4 stars because a few of the colors will make you feel like you’re going to have a seizure if you use them too long.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pressly

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This has come in handy! Worked great for an elementary student I know who has been struggling with reading. My mom also uses it on her tablet and it works great. Such a simple tool that makes things a lot easier! There were no problems with the order itself, it was shipped quickly, and the strips were in perfect condition. The picture shown (of the different colors), is how it came in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Reading Guides
customer_reviews.text: This product is durable yet flexible. It came with a variety of colors. It is easily wiped off and fits in most text books and other books.
customer_reviews.author: Donna J Beck

customer_reviews.title: Great for all readers!
customer_reviews.text: This has really made a huge difference in my 7 yr old reading! He no longer gets caught up because he lost his place and he loves to use them as book marks!
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well for my 8 year old son ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well for my 8 year old son, who has difficulty with comprehension...however, its just been a few weeks/times that we've used them. Hopefully he will continue to improve.
customer_reviews.author: brandi vanderhoff

customer_reviews.title: The strips do their purpose. I have a kid ...
customer_reviews.text: The strips do their purpose. I have a kid who refuses to point to read but jump words at time. This does not help that since pointing at words is more beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Loni Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: These work wonderful for reports at work. The dark part helps to act as a ruler and guide old printed spreadsheets.
customer_reviews.author: Crazyfunmomof4

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am a special ed teacher and these helped my students with reading - especially chapter books.

customer_reviews.title: Makes reading fun!
customer_reviews.text: These have really helped two of my kids who were skipping words all the time when reading! They think they're fun to use! I didn't think I needed a pack of 7, but the kids loved getting to pick their own color.
customer_reviews.author: MintChocolateChip

customer_reviews.title: My boys are dyslexic and they really enjoyed these and seemed to help them keep on track ...
customer_reviews.text: My boys are dyslexic and they really enjoyed these and seemed to help them keep on track while reading which boosted there confidence levels.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for children needing a focus aid

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect! They help my students keep track of where they’re at while reading. Great quality- exactly what I wanted!!

customer_reviews.title: Works well and optional colors allows the best match for reading preferences
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a dyslexic child. Works well and optional colors allows the best match for reading preferences.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for struggling readers.
customer_reviews.text: These really help my daughter who has dyslexia and adhd. She is easily distracted and loses her place while reading. She doesn't seem to like one color more than another. They really keep her on track though. Work well for chapter books as well as textbooks.

customer_reviews.title: Helps with focus
customer_reviews.text: This was a suggestion to help a young reader. It helps him keep on track with reading. And helps to focus on each sentence.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!

customer_reviews.title: Helped both my kids
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I am glad that my kids had the ability to choose their favorite color because it definitely is a personal preference to how they see better.

customer_reviews.title: Discovered they're great for AMD too
customer_reviews.text: I used these with students who had reacking problems and dyslexia. (And recommend highly). Now I 've discovered they are great for age related vision problems too! My mom has age -related macular degeneration ans was struggling, so I bought them for her - she loves them! They've made a big difference for her as well! Great product!

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids who have difficulty tracking while reading.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for relectant readers and kids who have issues being able to track while reading and who lose their place a lot. The variety of colors is great since kids can choose the color they want and it gives them some power.

product_meta.title: Crystal Children and Teacher Supply Guided Reading Strips Asst. Set of 7 (Colored Overlays)
product_meta.description: Reading Guide Strips are designed to aid students & adults with the following difficulties: Skipping Words, Skipping Lines, Reversing Letters, Transposing Letters, Loosing your place, Re-reading lines, Squinting while reading, Concentration, Comprehension, red & watery eyes, reading fatigue. Most commonly suggested for: Visual Impairment, Dyslexia, Dysgraphia and other reading disorders. This set of Reading Guide Strips includes 7 strips 1.25" by 7.25" (Highlighting approximately one line of font (normal size (Size 14 and smaller). Strip colors will vary from Red, Blue, Orange, Pink, Green, Clear, Yellow, Purple, Gray and Aqua
feature_bullets: This set of Reading Guide Strips includes 7 strips 1.25 by 7.25
Highlighting approximately one line of font
Strip colors will vary from Red, Blue, Orange, Pink, Green, Clear and Yellow
Designed to aid students and adults with skipping words, skipping lines

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars363 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
